item.value: Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world.
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall. The tallest woman was Zeng Jinlian. She was 2.48 meters ( 8ft 2in ) tall.
The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
The explosion of Mount Tambora, on Sumbawa island, Indonesia in 1815 was heard 2,600 km (1,600 mi) away and has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
House flies have a lifespan of two weeks.
Michael Jackson's 1982 Thriller album is the biggest seller of all time. Over 110 millions albums were sold.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface.
Gravity keeps Earth and the other planets in our solar system in orbit around the Sun. It also keeps the Moon in orbit around Earth.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. It measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.

The original Olympic Games were a series of athletic competitions held in Ancient Greece. In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first powered, sustained, and controlled flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903. In 1919 the First transatlantic flight was made.
The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. It can run at 112 kilometres per hour (70 mph). The average person can run from 12 - 17 miles an hour in sprints, so keep away from cheetahs.
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).
In 1783 Sebastien Lenormand was first to demonstrate the parachute. In Missouri 1912, Captain Berry was the first to jump from a plane with a parachute.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
The Sun is one of about 200 billion stars in the Milky Way galaxy. The most current estimates guess that there are 100 to 200 billion galaxies in the Universe
